title: Strange packet loss(?) leading into frequent crashing
body:
I was in a game and I noticed I wasn't able to see any ability animations, and sometimes they would appear 3-4 seconds later where they were casted.

 e.g.- nami bubble gets thown out, my character freezes for the duration of the bubble but I see no animation, a few seconds later I see the bubble animation being played where the nami was, but is no longer.  This went on, tried to disconnect/reconnect about 2-3 times before it was fixed and then my game began crashing in between 40 seconds to a minute of being connected.

After a while it seemed to stabilize, also I usually get around 87-93ms during a match but my ping was frozen at 103ms every time on connecting.  FPS was always 100+.

Internet was working fine throughout the game, no problems connecting to any other services.

Specs:
i7-4790
8gb RAM
GeForce GTX 760

replies.body: Delays like that could be caused by packet loss, but it shouldn't be crashing your game.  To specify though, what do you mean by crash?  Are you getting a bugsplat error?  Also, run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) for an overview to see what exactly what's going on.  Let me know, and we can dig a bit deeper into this.

Thanks for the response!

I have about 8 network logs from that one game, I suppose from all my crashing/reconnecting.  The log reader came up with varying amounts of packet loss for every log.  The log reader wouldn't accept some of them but here are the ones it did accept.  

http://imgur.com/a/BEMyR

As for the crashing, no bugsplat, the game would just close very quickly and the client would be there with the reconnect button.

Thanks for the follow-up and details.  It looks like you've got some pretty big connection issues reaching the game server, ranging from instability to simply getting kicked off.  You should start off with the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to tighten up your connection and help rule out possibilities.  Test it out in a custom game, and let me know how it goes.
